articles.title: Justin Bieber reveals Lyme disease diagnosis
articles.description: Singer Justin Bieber revealed that he was diagnosed with Lyme disease in an Instagram post that called out those who have made comments about his appearance.
articles.content:
Singer Justin Bieber revealed Wednesday that he has been diagnosed with Lyme disease in an Instagram post that called out those who have made comments about his appearance in recent months.

articles.title: Florida woman gives birth to two sets of twins in one year
articles.description: Alexzandria Wolliston, who lives in Florida, gave birth to two sets of twin boys. Mark and Malakhi were born in March and Kaylen and Kaleb in December.
articles.content:
A Florida woman was doubly surprised last year to deliver two sets of twins and to learn they run in her family.
Alexzandria Wolliston holding Mark & Malakhi Quinn.Courtesy Alexzandria Wolliston

articles.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle go from royal romance to breakup with the royals
articles.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's romance bloomed in 2016, leading to a star-studded wedding and baby Archie, but unrelenting tabloid scrutiny took a toll.
articles.content:

articles.title: Boeing, NTSB likely won't investigate Tehran plane crash that killed 176, sources say
articles.description: Boeing likely won't be able to investigate Ukrainian International Airlines plane crash in Tehran, Iran that killed 176, sources say
articles.content:
The Ukrainian Boeing passenger plane crash that killed 176 people likely won't be investigated by the U.S. company or the National Transportation Safety Board, according to senior U.S. investigative sources.

articles.title: Environmental activists in Virginia declare 'major victory' in pipeline station battle
articles.description: A unanimous ruling from the 4th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals vacated a key permit to build a natural gas compressor station in a historic black community.
articles.content:
Opponents of a five-year-old plan to build a natural gas compressor station in a historically black community of Virginia say they've scored a "major victory" for environmental justice after a federal court invalidated a key permit for the project.
